catalog_info.title: Statistical Sleuthing Through Linear Models
catalog_info.notes: Fall: M., W., 9:30-11, and a weekly section to be arranged; Spring: To be aranged, and with a weekly section also to be arranged.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Statistics 100 or equivalent and Mathematics 19a and 19b or equivalent.
catalog_info.description: A serious introduction to statistical inference with linear models and related methods. Topics include t-tools and permutation-based alternatives, multiple-group comparisons, analysis of variance, linear regression, model checking and refinement, and causation versus correlation. Emphasis on thinking statistically, evaluating assumptions, and developing tools for real-life applications.
